variants.Description in input context: This variant results in a methionine to isoleucine substitution at position 358.

Material used.Description: Experiments were performed using the SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cell line, a widely used model for dopaminergic neurons.

Readout description.Result Description: The DJ-1 protein level was reduced by approximately 70% in cells carrying the NM_004009.3:c.1074A>G variant compared to wild-type controls.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent experiments (biological replicates) were conducted.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate (technical replicates).

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells transfected with an empty vector were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Studentâ€™s t-test was used to determine statistical significance.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: DJ-1 protein level between 80% and 120% of the mean of the control group

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: DJ-1 protein level outside the range of 80%-120% compared to control group

Material used.Description: Cells were fixed and stained using immunofluorescence to assess DJ-1 localization.

Readout description.Result Description: Immunofluorescence showed altered DJ-1 cytoplasmic distribution, suggesting impaired mitochondrial association in cells carrying the NM_004009.3:c.1074A>G variant compared to control cells.

Technical replicates.Description: Images were acquired at multiple locations for each condition.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: DJ-1 protein localization predominantly to mitochondria.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Shifted DJ-1 localization to the cytoplasm.
